Posts.Content: N.I.C.E. Ruling that herceptin goes hand in hand with chemo s they don't know how effective the herceptin is in its own. I did loads of searching before I had my diagnosis so I was prepared for anything xxx
Posts.Title: Triple positive - is chemo necessary?

Posts.Content: Good, once You step aboard the roller coaster, it whizzes you off , the waiting in between is the worst, but soon you'll be looking back, thinking how quick it has gone xxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy done...Hoorah...Onward and upward ;-)

Posts.Content: I was told to ask at the desk on the way out if I wanted copies of letters x
Posts.Title: which diagnosis is right ?

Posts.Content: I take mine when I get onto bed so I don't forget it, then any funny stuff will hopefully happen whilst asleep xxx
Posts.Title: Letrezole

Posts.Content: I was told that the radiotherapy scrambles the insides of the cells. The good ones reassemble and the cancer ones die. Therefore it affects the healed skin leading to shooting pains etc as everything knits back together. I finished about 5 weeks ago and although the top skin I'd starting to resemble the normal colour, I am still very sore xxx
Posts.Title: Post radiotherapy effects

Posts.Content: Fantastic news, you have been very strong throughout and the relief must be immense. The doctor wouldn't think anything of it and used to all kind of reactions, He was probably relieved that you didn't lol. Onwards and upwards, today is the first day of the rest of your life and it's looking GOOD! Xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Good news!!

Posts.Content: Yes you will be compensating with your other arm. Things will probably start to settle down when your affected arm gets stronger. I had my op at end of February and my operated arm still stings like the blazes if I do anything extra. Funnily enough, I went to docs with pain in right, but the c was in the left. So pain sometimes doesn't have a cause x
Posts.Title: UNDERARM PAIN

Posts.Content: You beat me to it bubble blower, I was going to say the same thing. I was bemoaning how much I weigh now, half a stone on in 3 weeks, (14st 10) my husband said 'never mind, you're alive and that's what counts' he's had a second birthday for 38 years, a month after his birthday, when he had a car crash. We can look at everything differently now, 'cos we have another crack at living the best we can x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!
